WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You have nine flags. With these nine flags you take them one by one and put them up your butt.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine taking these nine flags... count 'em... and putting them up your butt. With each one that's up there it gets harder and harder to fit the next one in.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Now that you have nine flags inside your butt, you have to get them out. But, you don't know how to. So you ask Siri (しり), "how do I get nine flags out of my butt?"
WaniKani_Reading_Info: In your head, doing the Siri voice, come up with an answer for your nine flags in the butt predicament.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: nine (九) corpses (尸) would have nine butts ...
humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle starts from " person " from ◎, ◎ indicates the body part of the person, which means the person's buttocks. The original meaning is hip, which is the original text of "尻". Xiaozhuan's " human " shape becomes " corpse " shape, from the sound of " nine ". "Said Wen. Shibu": "尻, 𦞠 also. Jiusheng from the corpse." Duan Yucai's note: "尻, today's vulgar Yungouzi is also. 𦞠, today's vulgar cloud butt is also. The analysis is two, and the general is one. "

Oracle is used as a place name and also as a person's name. For example, "Compilation" 13750 is: "Shiri is dead (no) 疒 (illness)." "Huadong" 336: "Gao Zijiri." "Zojiri" can be referred to as "尻". One said that the glyph of Oracle should be interpreted as " hip ", see " hip ".

The literature also means buttocks. Such as "Han Feizi. "Speaking of the Forest": "Three caress the Qijiri, but the horse does not stand." Cui Guicong of the Tang Dynasty "Notes of the Zihuajun Shrine in Zhaoting Mountain, Xuanzhou": "The hemorrhoids in the rest period, the ulcer developed in Shiri, and it is not easy to kneel From the beginning, until autumn is healed."

In some popular literature, or in some dialects, this word is often used as vulgar language.
humanum_short_description_en: Oracle starts from " person " from ◎, ◎ indicates the body parts of a person, and indicates the person's buttocks. The original meaning is hip, which is the original text of "尻".
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文從「人」從◎，◎指示人的身體部位，表示人的臀部。本義是臀部，是「尻」的初文。小篆「人」形變成「尸」形，從「九」聲。《說文．尸部》︰「尻，𦞠也。从尸九聲。」段玉裁注︰「尻，今俗云溝子是也。𦞠，今俗云屁股是也。析言是二，統言是一。」

　　甲骨文用作地名，又用作人名。如《合集》13750正：「尻亡（無）疒（疾）。」《花東》336：「告子尻。」「子尻」可省稱作「尻」。一說甲骨文的字形應釋為「臀」，參見「臀」。

　　文獻裡也表示臀部的意思。如《韓非子．說林下》：「三撫其尻而馬不踶。」唐代崔龜從〈宣州昭亭山梓華君神祠記〉：「余時方痔病，瘍發於尻，不便於跪起，至秋疾愈。」

　　在一些俗文學作品中，或一些方言裡，此字常被用作粗話。
humanum_short_description: 甲骨文從「人」從◎，◎指示人的身體部位，表示人的臀部。本義是臀部，是「尻」的初文。

尻尾(しっぽ): tail (animal)
尻(しり): buttocks, bottom

甲骨文從「 人 」從◎，◎指示人的身體部位，表示人的臀部。本義是臀部，是「 尻 」的初文。小篆「 人 」形變成「 尸 」形，從「 九 」聲。《說文．尸部》︰「尻，𦞠也。从尸九聲。」段玉裁注︰「尻，今俗云溝子是也。𦞠，今俗云屁股是也。析言是二，統言是一。」 甲骨文用作地名，又用作人名。如《合集》13750正：「尻亡（無）疒（疾）。」《花東》336：「告子尻。」「子尻」可省稱作「 尻 」。一說甲骨文的字形應釋為「 臀 」，參見「 臀 」。 文獻裡也表示臀部的意思。如《韓非子．說林下》：「三撫其尻而馬不踶。」唐代崔龜從〈宣州昭亭山梓華君神祠記〉：「余時方痔病，瘍發於尻，不便於跪起，至秋疾愈。」 在一些俗文學作品中，或一些方言裡，此字常被用作粗話。
Oracle starts from " person" from ◎, ◎ indicates the body part of the person, which means the person's buttocks. The original meaning is hip, which is the original text of " 尻". Xiaozhuan's " human" shape becomes " corpse" shape, from the sound of " nine". "Said Wen. Shibu": "尻, 𦞠 also. Jiusheng from the corpse." Duan Yucai's note: "尻, today's vulgar Yungouzi is also. 𦞠, today's vulgar cloud butt is also. The analysis is two, and the general is one. " Oracle is used as a place name and also as a person's name. For example, "Compilation" 13750 is: "Shiri is dead (no) 疒 (illness)." "Huadong" 336: "Gao Zijiri." "Zojiri" can be referred to as " 尻". One said that the glyph of Oracle should be interpreted as " hip", see " hip". The literature also means buttocks. Such as "Han Feizi. "Speaking of the Forest": "Three caress the Qijiri, but the horse does not stand." Cui Guicong of the Tang Dynasty "Notes of the Zihuajun Shrine in Zhaoting Mountain, Xuanzhou": "The hemorrhoids in the rest period, the ulcer developed in Shiri, and it is not easy to kneel From the beginning, until autumn is healed." In some popular literature, or in some dialects, this word is often used as vulgar language.

尻字的基本解释

尻
kāo
屁股，脊骨的末端：尻骨（坐骨）。
家畜外形部位名称（以髋骨、荐骨和部分尾椎骨为基础，前连腰，下接股。是推动后股运步的重要部位）。

尻字的汉语字典释义

[①]［kāo］
［《廣韻》苦刀切，平豪，溪。］
(1)脊骨末端，臀部。
(2)引申为尽头，末端。
(3)肛门。

尻字的康熙字典解释

【寅集上】【尸字部】　尻； 康熙笔画：5； 页码：页300第02
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】?丘刀切，考平聲。【說文】脽也。从尸九聲。【玉篇】髖也。【增韻】脊。骨盡處。【禮·內則】兔去尻。【莊子·達生篇】加汝尻雕俎之上。【屈原·天問】崑崙縣圃，其尻安在。【註】尻，脊骨盡處。以山至高，其下必有托根之所也。　【集韻】或作?。亦作?。【正字通】从尸从九，與凥別。改九从兀，非。

尻字的源字形

字源演变：

甲骨文小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
尻字的起名意思

屁股。“一狼洞其中，只露尻尾”。

Jiri
Basic explanation of words
Jiri
kāo
The buttocks, the end of the spine: the shiris (sciatic bones).
The name of the external shape of the livestock (based on the hip bone, sacrum and part of the tail vertebrae, connected to the waist in the front, and connected to the thigh below. It is an important part to promote the movement of the back thigh).
Jiri

[①]［kāo］
["Guangyun" bitterly cut, Pinghao, Xi. ]
(1) The end of the spine, buttocks.
(2) The extension is the end and the end.
(3) Anus.

kāo
1) крестец, копчик; зад (скотины, человека)
尻骨 кости крестца
2) основа, основание, начало
其尻安在 где же их (гор) основание?
3) груб. ебать
Radicals: 尸, 九  (flag, nine)
Meaning Mnemonic
You have nine flags. With these nine flags you take them one by one and put them up your butt.
Imagine taking these nine flags... count 'em... and putting them up your butt. With each one that's up there it gets harder and harder to fit the next one in.
Reading Mnemonic
Now that you have nine flags inside your butt, you have to get them out. But, you don't know how to. So you ask Siri (しり), "how do I get nine flags out of my butt?"
In your head, doing the Siri voice, come up with an answer for your nine flags in the butt predicament.
